basics.name: Will Dunlop MSc ACA
basics.label: Full-Breadth Developer
basics.summary: Full-Breadth Developer leveraging experience as a ICAEW Chartered Accountant to build specialized solutions for the finance industry, ranging from data analytics to automations and agentic AI.

work.name: Grant Thornton UK LLP
work.summary: Designed and developed various automation and analytics tools for the audit and assurance practice.
highlights: Automated the generation of the public facing external auditor reports that are submitted to Companies House. The software has been internally valued to generate >£0.5m of savings and was voted as the practice's favourite internally developed tool.
Pioneered a Global Audit Common Data Model for Grant Thornton International; Grant Thornton's international network of firms, including Grant Thornton US.
Developed and designed over 10 digital audit tools, ranging from automations to data analtics.
Researched and prototyped agentic AI solutions for audit.
Successfully integrated open-banking technology for audit engagements, generating savings of ~£0.7 per annum.

work.name: Grant Thornton UK LLP
work.summary: Conducted financial statement audits for mid-market commercial entities and groups.
highlights: Qualified as an ICAEW ACA Chartered Accountant and obtained the ICAEW Audit Qualification (AQ).
Worked directly with client senior finance personnel and led Audit Associates to ensure that financial statements were in line with financial reporting standards, including UK GAAP FRS 102 and IFRS.
Developed Excel wizardry and proficiency in programming languages, such as Python and VBA, resulting in automated workpapers and a programme to extract and match core invoice data to samples.

work.name: Business West
work.summary: Coordinated the European REgional Development Fund (ERDF) funded Innovate2Succeed programme, assisting businesses to develop new products.
highlights: Trained, and accredited, in the use of GROWTHmapper (Oxford Innovation)
Developed proficiency in administrating Microsoft Dynamics and SalesForce.
Identified and made significant improvements via automations, resulting in the time taken to complete an administrative task reducing from 2 weeks to less than 1 hour.

work.name: Impact Mentoring
work.summary: Assistedin a wide range of functions across finance and operations helping to faciliate the scaling up of a successful start up in the NatWest Entrepreneur Hub.
highlights: Project managed the implementation of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR); took responsibility as Data Protection Officer (DPO), improved cyber security, ensured that stystems and practices were GDPR compliant.

work.name: Hargreaves Lansdown
work.summary: Supported clients' Stocks & Shares ISAs and SIPPs over the beginning and end of the tax year.
highlights: Infomred in the rules and regulations pertaining to financial firms, including CASS.
Documented a business process flowchart diagram.

work.name: Engine Shed
work.summary: Supported Engine Shed, Business West, The University of Bristol and the West of England Combined Authority (WECA)/Growth Hub to research and analyse the scale-up clusters and support, as well launch the Scale-up Generator Map web application to help entrepreneurs visualize and gain access to support.
highlights: Formatted data into JSON for the web application

volunteer.summary: Sold programmes and performed hospitally work at UpFest to fundraise for NACOA.
Laid the groundwork to build a school in a remote village in Laos.

projects.name: ERDF Innovate2Succeed
projects.summary: At Business West, I supported the delivery of the European Regional Development Fund's (ERDF) Innovate2Succeed programme in conjunction with Innovate UK to assist businesses with innovation.

projects.name: Scale Up Ecosystem Project
projects.summary: Supported Engine Shed, Business West, The University of Bristol and the West of England Combined Authority (WECA)/Growth Hub to research and analyse the scale-up clusters and support, as well launch the Scale-up Generator Map web application to help entrepreneurs visualize and gain access to support.

projects.name: Coffee, Wanting & Liking
projects.summary: Funded by Coca Cola®, at The University of Bristol, I performed the Experimental Psychology study to address the question 'does coffee taste better when one is caffeine deprived?'
